hints.content:
To find how many feet Milo cut, we start with the $\purpleD{\text{tree length}}$ and subtract the $\blueE{\text{new tree length}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/aba4c6e2784544bcabacb11d46b06d0d82bb1acb)

$\purpleD{74} \text { ft}-\blueE{39} \text { ft}= \maroonD{\Large\Box} \text{ ft}$

Let's subtract to find the difference.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fa286a9ac4af811f230ddfe259e51d39d2b75958)

$\purpleD{74}\text{ ft}  - \blueE{39}\text{ ft}  = \maroonD{35}\text{ ft}$
Milo cut $\maroonD{35}\text{ ft}$ off the tree.

question.content:
Milo is cutting down part of a tree to make firewood. The tree is $74\text{ feet}$ tall.  He decides to cut off part of the tree so it is now only $39\text{ feet}$.  

**How many feet did Milo cut off of the tree?**
  
[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{ft}$
